title: Cup of Nations Match Preview : Czechia v Spain
body_text:
Czechia and Spain will face off on the final matchday of the 2023 Cup of Nations, playing the opening game of the doubleheader at McDonald Jones Stadium.
Read our preview of the match.
This tournament will mark the eighth time the two countries have played one another in an 'A' international, with their last meeting seeing Spain record a 4-0 win over Czechia in the UEFA Women's Euro 2022 qualifying.
Spain went on to top their qualifying group with seven wins, while Czechia finished in second spot and missed out on qualifying for their first major tournament.
Seven previous meetings for the two sides have seen Spain collect six wins and one draw in 2007. Spain had four different goalscorers in their last win over their fellow UEFA compatriots, with Esther González, Patricia Guijarro, Aitana Bonmatí and Alexia Putellas finding the back of the net.
While most of Czechia's team ply their trade in their own country, midfielder Klára Cahynová is familiar with the Spanish style of football, having played for Sevilla FC since 2021.
2023 CUP OF NATIONS – MATCH SCHEDULE
Match Day One
Date: Thursday, 16 February 2023
Venue: Industree Group Stadium, Gosford, NSW
Match One: Spain v Jamaica – 4.10 pm kick-off AEDT. Broadcast on Paramount+
Match Two: CommBank Matildas v Czechia – 7.10 pm kick-off AEDT. Broadcast on 10 Bold, 10 Play and Paramount+
Tickets: Buy tickets!
Match Day Two
Date: Sunday, 19 February 2023
Venue: CommBank Stadium, Sydney, NSW
Match One: Jamaica v Czechia – 2.50 pm AEDT. Broadcast on Paramount+
Match Two: CommBank Matildas v Spain – 6.00 pm AEDT. Broadcast on 10 Bold, 10 Play and Paramount+
Tickets: Buy tickets!
Match Day Three
Date: Wednesday, 22 February 2023
Venue: McDonald Jones Stadium, Newcastle, NSW
Match One: Czechia v Spain – 2.30 pm kick-off AEDT. Broadcast on Paramount+
Match Two: CommBank Matildas v Jamaica – 7.10 pm kick-off AEDT. Broadcast on 10 Bold, 10 Play and Paramount+
Tickets: Buy tickets!
